title: Build member management interface for admins

requirements.text: Create backend functions to add new members with fields for name, role, photo URL, and optional bio, accessible only to admin users

quotes: I can't see logged in members either
how do I add members under the members list

acceptanceCriteria: Admin users can call a backend function to create new member entries
Member creation requires name and role at minimum
Photo URL and bio are optional fields
Non-admin users cannot create members
Function returns success confirmation or error

requirements.text: Create backend functions to update existing member information including name, role, photo URL, and bio, accessible only to admin users
acceptanceCriteria: Admin users can update any field of an existing member
Updates are validated before persisting
Non-admin users cannot edit members
Function returns updated member data or error

requirements.text: Create backend function to delete members from the roster, accessible only to admin users
acceptanceCriteria: Admin users can delete members by member ID
Deleted members are permanently removed from the roster
Non-admin users cannot delete members
Function returns confirmation of deletion

requirements.text: Create an admin-only Member Management page with a form to add new members, requiring fields for name and role, with optional fields for photo URL and bio

quotes: Add new members by entering their details (name, role, photo)

acceptanceCriteria: Page is accessible only to users with admin privileges
Form includes required fields for name and role
Form includes optional fields for photo URL and bio
Form validates inputs before submission
Success and error messages display via toast notifications
Member list refreshes after successful addition

requirements.text: Add an edit interface to the Member Management page displaying all current members with edit and delete buttons for each member
acceptanceCriteria: Current members are displayed in a list or grid format
Each member entry shows an edit button and delete button
Edit button opens a form pre-filled with current member data
Delete button prompts for confirmation before removing
Changes reflect immediately in the member list
Toast notifications confirm successful edits or deletions

requirements.text: Add a role selector dropdown to the member add and edit forms with predefined roles: President, Vice President, Road Captain, Secretary, Sergeant at Arms, Treasurer, and Member

quotes: President, Vice President, Road Captain, Secretary, Members, etc.

acceptanceCriteria: Dropdown includes all predefined club roles
Selected role is highlighted in the dropdown
Role selection is required for both add and edit operations
Role changes are saved when the form is submitted

requirements.text: Add a navigation link to the Member Management page in the navbar, visible only to admin users

quotes: build a Member Management interface for admins

acceptanceCriteria: Link appears in the navbar when user has admin privileges
Link is hidden for non-admin users
Link navigates to the Member Management page when clicked
Link styling matches the existing navbar design

requirements.text: Update the Members roster page to dynamically display members from the backend instead of using a static list, showing member name, role, photo, and bio when available

quotes: I can't see logged in members either
the Members roster currently displays a static list

acceptanceCriteria: Members page fetches and displays members from backend data
Each member card shows name, role, and photo if provided
Bio displays when available
Empty state message displays when no members exist
Loading state displays while fetching members

constraints: Do not modify Internet Identity authentication logic in useInternetIdentity.ts
Do not edit components in frontend/src/components/ui directory
Do not change the existing admin privilege detection system
Maintain the single-actor backend architecture in backend/main.mo
nonGoals: Linking members to user accounts or logged-in user profiles
Automatic member creation when users log in
Member profile pages separate from the roster view
Photo upload functionality (use URL input instead)
Batch member import or export features
